intro: Polycarpaea inaequalifolia, commonly known as the unequal-leaved polycarpaea, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its opposite, ovate to elliptic leaves that vary in size along the stem, giving it its common name. The plant produces small, clustered white to pinkish flowers with four petals, typically blooming in the spring. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa and thrives in moist, shaded environments. The species is often found in forest understories and is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting local wildlife.
